column3: Endurance Wind Power (E-3120 - DISCONTINUED); SWCC certified specs; NREL ATB 2024; PNNL Distributed Wind Market Report 2024

column1: # DESCRIPTION: Research-grade wind turbine specifications for 3 distributed-scale turbines based on real products and certified performance data

# LOGIC: Specifications from manufacturer datasheets and SWCC/IEC certifications. Rated speeds are 10-11 m/s (industry standard for this size class). Capacity factors are conservative estimates for Sinai coastal site (5-7 m/s annual avg at hub height)
column2: accounting for dust and heat derating.

column1: # ASSUMPTIONS: (1) Bergey Excel 10 has no traditional cut-out (uses autofurl at 15.6 m/s); 25 m/s used as modeling simplification. (2) Eocycle IEC-certified CF of 44% at 6 m/s derated to 25% for hot dusty conditions. (3) Endurance E-3120 rated at 50kW (50Hz version at 10 m/s) â€” DISCONTINUED (bankruptcy Nov 2016). Specs retained as physical reference for the 50kW class. Closest current alternatives: XZERES Wind 50 (51kW
column3: Aeolos-H 50kW. (4) Hub heights reflect typical installations for each model.

column1: # DATA_QUALITY: HIGH for Bergey/Eocycle (active products with current certifications). MEDIUM for Endurance (certified specs but product no longer manufactured).
# COMPARISON_TO_TOY: Toy rated speeds (6-7 m/s) are ~60% too low vs real products (10-11 m/s). Toy rotor diameters and cut-in speeds are reasonable. Toy hub heights slightly high for medium/large.
